meanings.definition: The state or quality of being slimy.
meanings.sent1: The pond was full of liminesses after the rain.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the liminesses of the mud squishing beneath my feet.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added extra liminesses to the soup, making it extra slippery.
meanings.sent4: The slimy tentacles of the octopus were a perfect example of liminesses in nature.
meanings.sent5: The slimy liminesses of the slug left a trail along the garden path.

meanings.definition: The slimy texture or consistency of something.
meanings.sent1: She recoiled at the touch of the slimy liminesses on the rock.
meanings.sent2: The liminesses of the algae made the surface dangerously slippery.
meanings.sent3: The liminesses of the jellyfish made it look like a wobbly dessert.
meanings.sent4: The liminesses of the fish scales shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The slimy liminesses of the snail shell glistened in the moonlight.
